@graph.name: Frames iOS
@graph.description: Frames is the analog photography notebook for film photographers. Record settings, notes, and embed metadata into scanned photos. Available for iPhone and Mac.
@graph.keywords: frames,film photography notes,analog notes,film metadata,analog metadata,photo notebook,photo notes,analog photography,film photography,film exif,analog exif,film camera,datafilm

review.name: Great App to organize film notes
review.reviewBody: Exactly what I needed to organize my film notes. Simple and effective, film photography is not dead! ;)

@graph.name: Frames macOS
@graph.description: Frames is the analog photography notebook for film photographers. Record settings, notes, and embed metadata into scanned photos. Available for iPhone and Mac.

@graph.description: Frames is the analog photography notebook for film photographers. Record settings, notes, and embed metadata into scanned photos. Available for iPhone and Mac.

@graph.name: Frames iOS App â€“ Toolbar Controls Preview
@graph.description: A quick preview of the toolbar controls in the Frames iOS app, designed for film photographers to log and manage metadata.

@graph.name: Which photo file formats are supported by the macOS app?

acceptedAnswer.text: At the moment, the macOS companion app supports JPEG (.jpg) files for metadata embedding and export. TIFF (.tif) support is under consideration and may be added in the future depending on user demand.

@graph.name: Will there be an Android version of the app?

acceptedAnswer.text: An Android version is being considered. For now, the focus is on perfecting the iPhone and macOS apps. If successful, Android may follow in the future.

@graph.name: Which kinds of metadata can I record with the app?

acceptedAnswer.text: You can record camera settings like shutter speed, aperture, lens, focal length, film stock, GPS location, and custom notes for each shot.

@graph.name: What features are planned for the future?

acceptedAnswer.text: Planned features include translations, additional export formats, and potentially a watchOS companion app for faster access during shoots.

@graph.name: Can I log things like my tripod setup, filters, or other accessories?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. While not part of standard EXIF fields, there's a flexible Notes field where you can log tripod use, filters, and other gear details.
